content: 1 Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the choice ones of God, and an acknowledging of truth that is according to piety,
content_old: 1 Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of the choice ones of God, and an acknowledging of truth that is according to piety,

content: 2 upon hope of life age-during, which God, who doth not lie, did promise before times of ages,
content_old: 2 upon hope of life age-during, which God, who doth not lie, did promise before times of ages,

content: 3 (and He manifested in proper times His word,) in preaching, which I was entrusted with, according to a charge of God our Saviour,
content_old: 3 (and He manifested in proper times His word,) in preaching, which I was entrusted with, according to a charge of God our Saviour,

content: 4 to Titus—true child according to a common faith: Grace, kindness, peace, from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour!
content_old: 4 to Titus—true child according to a common faith: Grace, kindness, peace, from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour!

content: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, that the things lacking thou mayest arrange, and mayest set down in every city elders, as I did appoint to thee.
content_old: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, that the things lacking thou mayest arrange, and mayest set down in every city elders, as I did appoint to thee.

content: 6 If any one is blameless, of one wife a husband, having children stedfast, not under accusation of riotous living or insubordinate—
content_old: 6 If any one is blameless, of one wife a husband, having children stedfast, not under accusation of riotous living or insubordinate—

content: 7 for it behoveth the overseer to be blameless, as God’s steward, not self-pleased, nor irascible, not given to wine, not a striker, not given to filthy lucre;
content_old: 7 for it behoveth the overseer to be blameless, as God’s steward, not self-pleased, nor irascible, not given to wine, not a striker, not given to filthy lucre;

content: 8 but a lover of strangers, a lover of good men, sober-minded, righteous, kind, self-controlled,
content_old: 8 but a lover of strangers, a lover of good men, sober-minded, righteous, kind, self-controlled,

content: 9 holding—according to the teaching—to the stedfast word, that he may be able also to exhort in the sound teaching, and the gainsayers to convict;
content_old: 9 holding—according to the teaching—to the stedfast word, that he may be able also to exhort in the sound teaching, and the gainsayers to convict;

content: 10 for there are many both insubordinate, vain-talkers, and mind-deceivers—especially they of the circumcision—
content_old: 10 for there are many both insubordinate, vain-talkers, and mind-deceivers—especially they of the circumcision—

content: 11 whose mouth it behoveth to stop, who whole households do overturn, teaching what things it behoveth not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
content_old: 11 whose mouth it behoveth to stop, who whole households do overturn, teaching what things it behoveth not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

content: 12 A certain one of them, a prophet of their own, said—‘Cretans! always liars, evil beasts, lazy bellies!’
content_old: 12 A certain one of them, a prophet of their own, said—‘Cretans! always liars, evil beasts, lazy bellies!’

content: 13 this testimony is true; for which cause convict them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
content_old: 13 this testimony is true; for which cause convict them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

content: 14 not giving heed to Jewish fables and commands of men, turning themselves away from the truth;
content_old: 14 not giving heed to Jewish fables and commands of men, turning themselves away from the truth;

content: 15 all things, indeed, are pure to the pure, and to the defiled and unstedfast is nothing pure, but of them defiled are even the mind and the conscience;
content_old: 15 all things, indeed, are pure to the pure, and to the defiled and unstedfast is nothing pure, but of them defiled are even the mind and the conscience;

content: 1 And thou—be speaking what doth become the sound teaching;
content_old: 1 And thou—be speaking what doth become the sound teaching;

content: 2 aged men to be temperate, grave, sober, sound in the faith, in the love, in the endurance;
content_old: 2 aged men to be temperate, grave, sober, sound in the faith, in the love, in the endurance;

content: 3 aged women, in like manner, in deportment as doth become sacred persons, not false accusers, to much wine not enslaved, of good things teachers,
content_old: 3 aged women, in like manner, in deportment as doth become sacred persons, not false accusers, to much wine not enslaved, of good things teachers,

content: 4 that they may make the young women sober-minded, to be lovers of their husbands, lovers of their children,
content_old: 4 that they may make the young women sober-minded, to be lovers of their husbands, lovers of their children,

content: 5 sober, pure, keepers of their own houses, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of.
content_old: 5 sober, pure, keepers of their own houses, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of.

content: 6 The younger men, in like manner, be exhorting to be sober-minded;
content_old: 6 The younger men, in like manner, be exhorting to be sober-minded;

content: 7 concerning all things thyself showing a pattern of good works; in the teaching uncorruptedness, gravity, incorruptibility,
content_old: 7 concerning all things thyself showing a pattern of good works; in the teaching uncorruptedness, gravity, incorruptibility,

content: 8 discourse sound, irreprehensible, that he who is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say concerning you.
content_old: 8 discourse sound, irreprehensible, that he who is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say concerning you.

content: 9 Servants—to their own masters are to be subject, in all things to be well-pleasing, not gainsaying,
content_old: 9 Servants—to their own masters are to be subject, in all things to be well-pleasing, not gainsaying,

content: 10 not purloining, but showing all good stedfastness, that the teaching of God our Saviour they may adorn in all things.
content_old: 10 not purloining, but showing all good stedfastness, that the teaching of God our Saviour they may adorn in all things.

content: 11 For the saving grace of God was manifested to all men,
content_old: 11 For the saving grace of God was manifested to all men,

content: 12 teaching us, that denying the impiety and the worldly desires, soberly and righteously and piously we may live in the present age,
content_old: 12 teaching us, that denying the impiety and the worldly desires, soberly and righteously and piously we may live in the present age,

content: 13 waiting for the blessed hope and manifestation of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,
content_old: 13 waiting for the blessed hope and manifestation of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,

content: 14 who did give himself for us, that he might ransom us from all lawlessness, and might purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
content_old: 14 who did give himself for us, that he might ransom us from all lawlessness, and might purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

content: 1 Remind them to be subject to principalities and authorities, to obey rule, unto every good work to be ready,
content_old: 1 Remind them to be subject to principalities and authorities, to obey rule, unto every good work to be ready,

content: 2 of no one to speak evil, not to be quarrelsome—gentle, showing all meekness to all men,
content_old: 2 of no one to speak evil, not to be quarrelsome—gentle, showing all meekness to all men,

content: 3 for we were once—also we—thoughtless, disobedient, led astray, serving desires and pleasures manifold, in malice and envy living, odious—hating one another;
content_old: 3 for we were once—also we—thoughtless, disobedient, led astray, serving desires and pleasures manifold, in malice and envy living, odious—hating one another;

content: 4 and when the kindness and the love to men of God our Saviour did appear
content_old: 4 and when the kindness and the love to men of God our Saviour did appear

content: 5 (not by works that are in righteousness that we did but according to His kindness,) He did save us, through a bathing of regeneration, and a renewing of the Holy Spirit,
content_old: 5 (not by works that are in righteousness that we did but according to His kindness,) He did save us, through a bathing of regeneration, and a renewing of the Holy Spirit,

content: 6 which He poured upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour,
content_old: 6 which He poured upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour,

content: 7 that having been declared righteous by His grace, heirs we may become according to the hope of life age-during.
content_old: 7 that having been declared righteous by His grace, heirs we may become according to the hope of life age-during.

content: 8 Stedfast is the word; and concerning these things I counsel thee to affirm fully, that they may be thoughtful, to be leading in good works—who have believed God; these are the good and profitable things to men.
content_old: 8 Stedfast is the word; and concerning these things I counsel thee to affirm fully, that they may be thoughtful, to be leading in good works—who have believed God; these are the good and profitable things to men.

content: 9 And foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about law, stand away from—for they are unprofitable and vain.
content_old: 9 And foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about law, stand away from—for they are unprofitable and vain.

content: 10 A sectarian man, after a first and second admonition be rejecting,
content_old: 10 A sectarian man, after a first and second admonition be rejecting,

content: 11 having known that he hath been subverted who is such, and doth sin, being self-condemned.
content_old: 11 having known that he hath been subverted who is such, and doth sin, being self-condemned.

content: 12 When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis, for there to winter I have determined.
content_old: 12 When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis, for there to winter I have determined.

content: 13 Zenas the lawyer and Apollos bring diligently on their way, that nothing to them may be lacking,
content_old: 13 Zenas the lawyer and Apollos bring diligently on their way, that nothing to them may be lacking,

content: 14 and let them learn—ours also—to be leading in good works to the necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
content_old: 14 and let them learn—ours also—to be leading in good works to the necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
